chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joseph Michael Lambert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/schooling or combination of the two.  If not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
No possession of any dangerous weapons.
No contact with K.K. and E.A. unless approved by agent.

SAFE program.  Co-parenting class if available.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:00 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF743, 14CF914, AND 14CF915. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to file amended information in 14CF915. COURT grants. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF743: Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment/DA)>>AMEND to DC/DA pursuant to 947.01(1) with charging language of unreasonably loud conduct. 
In 14CF914: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF915: Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Entry Into a Locked Dwelling)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Misd. Theft)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF743: Amended Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF915: Ct. 1 (Misd. Take and Drive Vehicle without consent - joyriding)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 7 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty, and defers entry of judgment on Cts. 2 & 3 in 14CF915. 

COURT ORDERS: In 14CF915: On Cts. 2 and 3>>DEOJ for 3 with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
                           : On remaining 3 misd. counts>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program; co-parenting class if available; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; no contact with K.K. and E.A. unless approved by agent; no possession of any dangerous weapons; restitution of $102.59 to E.A; court costs including 2 DA surcharges. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 42 days jail credit on all if revoked. 
Atty Ley requests bond be amended to signature bond. 
COURT modifies bond to $30,000 signature bond with same conditions except no contact provision is removed. 
COURT notes $3000 cash bond to be used toward payment of court costs. 
Review of DEOJ set for 4/12/2018 at 1:10 pm with Br. 2 JA. 
Adj: 4:15 pm
E.J.A.

AMENDED: $30,000.00 signature bond with first $3,000.00 in cash TO BE CO-SIGNED BY DEFENDANT'S FATHER.  BOND INCLUDES 14CF743, 14CF914, 14CF915.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s): (NON WAIVABLE); K.K.; E.A. Case Called: 2:35 p.m. 
**Includes 14CF743, 14CF914 & 14CF915**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley. 
Date & time set for motion to modify bond. Atty Ley is requesting bond modification for contact with defendant's 2 minor children. State objects to bond modification but notes victim is in agreement with allowing contact with children.

All other conditions to remain in effect. 
Future dates to be set with JA.
